text:
This does not directly answer your question, so please ignore if it doesn't feel useful :slightly_smiling_face:

I felt very similar to what you're describing, my interest was (and remains!) much more in TOFU content. If I had a redo, I would have invested more time understanding what makes great BOFU content. I think I was far too "order-taking" on this and didn't use it as an opportunity to wear a product marketing hat.

What sales asks for at this stage is often not interesting -- a 1 pager on this, a deck on that. But get into April Dunford (positioning) and Andy Raskin and Marcus Andrews' on narrative design and there's some really high-impact, fantastic storytelling opportunities at this stage of the funnel.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz
